children.value: This tutorial helps you deploy Apollo Server to Google Cloud Functions. It uses the following example function handler:
Deploying from the Google Cloud Console
From your Google Cloud Console, go to the
. Give the function a name and set the
For quick setup and access to the GraphQL endpoint/playground, choose to
. To require authentication for this endpoint, you can manage authorized users via
Save your configuration changes in the Trigger section. Copy the trigger's URL for later and click
2. Write the API handlers and deploy
Now on the Code page, set the runtime to a currently supported version of Node.js (such as
), and set the Entry point to
Paste the example code at the top of this page into the contents of
to initiate deployment. Then, proceed to
Before proceeding, you need to set up the gcloud SDK:
Initialize the gcloud SDK and authenticate your Google account
Next, initialize a new Node.js project by running
to install the necessary dependencies and to include them in the
and paste the sample code at the top of this page into it.
Run the following command to create and deploy the function to Cloud Functions:
gcloud functions deploy apollo-graphql-example --entry-point handler --runtime nodejs14 --trigger-http
that you can view from your console's
The command asks some configuration questions and prints metadata about your newly created function, which includes the function's trigger URL.
For more information, see the official
After deployment completes, navigate to your function's trigger URL. If deployment succeeded, GraphQL Playground opens.
If you can't access your trigger URL, you might need to
You can use GraphQL Playground to test the following query:
And verify that the following response appears:
To obtain information about a currently executing Google Cloud Function (HTTP headers, HTTP method, body, path, etc.) use the
option. This enables you to pass any request-specific data to your server's resolvers.
To enable CORS, you need to modify your HTTP response headers. To do so, use the
To enable CORS response for requests with credentials (cookies, HTTP authentication) the allow origin header must equal the request origin and the allow credential header must be set to
with the following fields(all are optional):
